intro: Amsinckia intermedia, commonly known as the desert parsley, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of theApiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought and heat. Its small, white to yellowish flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a taproot system that allows it to access deep water sources, contributing to its survival in harsh conditions.
